reference.text: ; indicating or measuring level of liquid in general G01F23/00; measuring density G01N, e.g. G01N9/00; measuring electric variables G01R

CPC-specific-text.text: for several batteries or cells simultaneously or sequentially
for measuring electrolyte level, electrolyte density or electrolyte conductivity
Cells or batteries combined with indicating means for externally visualisation of the condition, e.g. by change of colour or of light intensity

title-part.text: Heating or cooling or regulating temperature

reference.text: control of temperature in general G05D23/00

notes-and-warnings.note: Groups H01M10/5002 to H01M10/5097 are not complete, pending reclassification. See also H01M10/50, H01M10/50B, T01M6/50S2-T01M6/50S2R

CPC-specific-text.text: Uniformity or distribution of temperature in space
specially adapted for a specific application
Portable devices, e.g. mobiles, cameras, pacemakers
Stationary plants, e.g. power plant buffering, backup power supplies

reference.text: measurement of temperature H01M10/486; charging and discharging in response to temperature H01M10/443

CPC-specific-text.text: characterized by method steps, e.g. algorithms, flow charts, software details
characterised by the use of reversible temperature sensitive devices, e.g. NTC, PTC, bimetal or by control of the internal current flowing through the battery, e.g. by switching

reference.text: H01M2/34 takes precedence; Temperature sensitive safety devices for primary or secondary batteries H01M2200/10

CPC-specific-text.text: characterized by the shape of the cells
Prismatic or flat, e.g. pouch cells
Means for temperature regulation having parts combined with the battery
characterized by values or quantitative relationships, e.g. ratios, sizes, formulas, concentrations
characterized by electrically insulating, thermally conductive materials
inside the innermost case of the battery, e.g. mandrels, electrodes, electrolytes
Solid structures for heat-exchange or conduction
Surfaces specially adapted for heat dissipation or radiation, e.g. fins, coatings
Closed pipes transferring heat by thermal conductivity and phase transition, e.g. heat pipes
Solid parts specially adapted for heat conduction other than terminals or leads, e.g. rods, plates
Solid parts with flow channels or tubes for heat exchange
Recirculation or a U-turn in the flow path, i.e. back and forth

title-part.text: [Means within the gas flows giving the gas flows around a cell or a battery a certain direction, e.g. manifolds, baffles, obstacles]

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by flow circuits external to the battery or the battery pack
Fluids undergoing a liquid-gas phase change, e.g. evaporation, condensation

reference.text: arrangements for heating the battery by its resistance to internal current H01M10/5026

CPC-specific-text.text: Heat storage or buffering, e.g. heat capacity, liquid-solid phase changes
Chemical reactions other than electrochemical reactions of the battery, e.g. catalytic heaters, burners
Heat exchange relationships between a battery and another system, e.g. air-conditioners, central heating systems, vehicle engines, electronic components, fuel cells, capacitors
the system being an air-conditioner or an engine
the system being an electronic component, e.g. CPU, inverter, capacitor

title-part.text: Removing gases inside the secondary cell, e.g. by absorption

reference.text: vent plugs or other mechanical arrangements for facilitating escape of gases H01M2/12

CPC-specific-text.text: by recombination on a catalytic material
by gas recombination on the electrode surface or by structuring the electrode surface to improve gas recombination

title-part.text: Reclaiming serviceable parts of waste accumulators

note.note-paragraph: Hybrid cells are electrochemical generators having two different types of half-cells, the half-cell being an electrode-electrolyte combination of either a primary, a secondary or a fuel cell.

CPC-specific-text.text: composed of a half-cell of the capacitor type and of a half-cell of the primary or secondary battery type

reference.text: of non-active parts H01M2/00; of electrodes H01M4/00

title-part.text: composed of a half-cell of the fuel-cell type and of a half-cell of the primary-cell type

reference.text: methods or arrangements for servicing or maintenance H01M6/50

title-part.text: with one metallic and one gaseous electrode

CPC-specific-text.text: with plate-like electrodes or stacks of plate-like electrodes

title-part.text: composed of a half-cell of a fuel-cell type and a half-cell of the secondary-cell type

reference.text: methods or arrangements for servicing or maintenance, e.g. for charging, H01M10/42

title-part.text: Electrochemical current or voltage generators not provided for in groups H01M6/00 - H01M12/00

reference.text: light sensitive devices H01G9/20, semiconductors sensitive to light H01Ll31/00

title-part.text: Structural combinations of different types of electrochemical generators

CPC-specific-text.text: of fuel cells with other electrochemical devices, e.g. capacitors, electrolysers
of fuel cells with rechargeable batteries

title-part.text: Constructional details or processes of manufacture of the non-active parts

reference.text: working of plastics or substances in plastic stateB29

title-part.text: Cases with a shape not covered by groups H01M2/0207 to T01M2/02B6

CPC-specific-text.text: electrodes for hybrid or electric double capacitor H01G11/22

title-part.text: Electrodes composed of or comprising active material
Physical characteristics, e.g. porosity, surface area
Electrodes made of one single microscopic fiber
with shapes other than plane or cylindrical
Inert electrodes with catalytic activity, e.g. for fuel cells

note.note-paragraph: In this group, primary cells are electrochemical generators in which the cell energy is present in chemical form and is not regenerated.

title-part.text: Dry cells, i.e. cells wherein the electrolyte is rendered non-fluid
Methods or arrangements for servicing or maintenance, e.g. maintaining operating temperature

reference.text: cells or batteries combined with safety devices H01M2200/00

title-part.text: Aspects relating to capacity ratio of electrolyte/electrodes or anode/cathode

note.note-paragraph: Fuel cells are electrochemical generators wherein the reactants are supplied from outside

title-part.text: operating at high temperature, e.g. with stabilised ZrO2 electrolyte
Fuel cells with solid halide electrolytes
Fuel cells with solid oxide electrolytes

note.note-paragraph: Secondary cells are accumulators receiving and supplying electrical energy by means of reversible electrochemical reactions.

title-part.text: Methods or arrangements for servicing or maintenance of secondary cells or secondary half-cells

CPC-specific-text.text: Structural combination with electronic components, e.g. electronic circuits integrated to the outside of the casing

title-part.text: Battery management systems including electronic circuits, e.g. control of current or voltage to keep battery in healthy state, cell balancing
Systems for data transfer from batteries, e.g. transfer of battery parameters to a controller, data transferred between battery controller and main controller
Aspects relating to capacity ratio of electrodes/electrolyte or anode/cathode
Safety devices for primary or secondary batteries
Batteries in stationary systems, e.g. emergency power source in plant
Batteries in motive systems, e.g. vehicle, ship, plane
Batteries in portable systems, e.g. mobile phone, laptop
Specific features of fuel cell system
Fuel cells in stationary systems, e.g. emergency power source in plant
Fuel cells in motive systems, e.g. vehicle, ship, plane
Fuel cells in portable systems, e.g. mobile phone, laptop
Combination of fuel cells with other energy production systems
Combination of fuel cell with other electric generators

reference.text: combination of fuel cells with other electrochemical generator H01M16/003

title-part.text: Cogeneration of heat or hot water
Combination of fuel cells with mechanical energy generators
Room temperature molten salts comprising at least one organic ion
Molten electrolytes used at high temperature
in the form of layered products, e.g. coatings
